page.title: 06Pentre Dwfr.
page.content: Pentre Dwfr is in a steep sideded valley. Most of the mountains are covered in coniferous trees. The ground is too poor to grow crops and is mostly rough grazing. There are the remains of an old quarry on the left side. The school building has been closed for 4 years. The children of the village now go to Llangollen for their education. There was a chapel but this had been turned into a house and the pub had been made into a holiday home. There was a sign in a window of a house that read "yr hen siop" (the old shop) but it is not a shop today. The village has a bus stop, a letter box and a telephone box. There are several cattle grids to stop sheep wandering on the roads.
